intro: Ayenia saligna, commonly known as the silky ash or silky tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and delicate, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Ayenia saligna is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
